values:
There is a new promt fic by one of my all time favorite writers and dear friend Lily Grace over at Torquere Social that you shouldn't miss. It is so funny and so very sweet.

Here is the link:

http://torquere-social.livejournal.com/2083374.html

That story just made my day. Thank you Lily!

Still looking for the perfect Christmas present? The new holiday story ‘An Angel for Christmas’ by Lily Grace is out now.

Go to Torquere books

http://www.torquerebooks.com/index.php?main_page=product_info&manufacturers_id=323&products_id=2970

 

and treat yourself and/or your friends to this sweet, romantic story about a guardian angel and his charge. You will laugh, cry and sigh and forget to drink your eggnog and to eat your Christmas cookies over it.

 

Have a wonderful Christmas time!

My favorite author Lily Grace has her own blog now:

 

http://lilygracetales.blogspot.com


Check it out to catch up with what is going on in her life and with her current writing projects. Her wonderful first novella titled ‘An Angel for Christmas’ will be published by Torquere December 15 and I can’t wait to see the final version. Treat yourselves to a sweet, hot and romantic read as an early Christmas present.

Today the first original character short story by new m/m romance writer Lily Grace titled ‘Forces of Nature’ has been published by Torquere Books. Go to www.torquerebooks.com and buy it now. It will be the best thing you read in a long time, believe me. I know you will fall in love with best friends Evan and Drew who have denied their feeling for each other for eight years, believing an amazing friendship is all they will ever share. Getting caught in a thunderstorm together leads to shedding soaked clothes and baring not only their bodies but also their souls to each other in the process.

Lily Grace is not only the most talented writer ever but also the most wonderful, lovable, funny, generous, honest, inspiring, beautiful person and best friend. After falling in love with her fanfiction writing I started pestering her to try her hand in original character slash. That was just a few months ago and now she is already a published writer. See what I mean? That is one fast-moving, inspired, determined, hard-working and talented woman.

I am so proud of her. Now make me even more proud and read her lovely story. And leave praise at her new LJ http://lily-c-grace.livejournal.com/.

Love, Anja

This is going to be long and there is going to be no cut, because you need to read this – your help is required.

My new guilty pleasure is hunting down OC m/m romance stories that have cross-dressing characters in them who look like Brian Molko of Placebo in his Nancy Boy days.

Why I am so totally obsessed with it now? I have no idea. I mean, I abandoned reading real people slash and fan-fiction of any kind or fandom – not only Placebo-slash - over a year ago, when I found out that there are tons of much better written stories with sexy original characters out there, that I can gobble up just as fast without needing to wait for a paperback to arrive in the mail or go out to a book store. You got to love the instant gratification of buying an e-book and diving into a new story that picked your interest by reading a fascinating summery and excerpt. The wonders of gay erotic fiction e-books definitely made me stay at home in front of my computer a lot more than I used to, but on the other hand it also made me find new friends on the net and it made me watch less TV. See, m/m romance e-books only do good things for you.

After getting addicted to them and reading hundreds of stories I obviously needed to specialise a bit to feel really excited about a story again. I still enjoy reading all kinds of different stories with pretty boys in them, but cross-dressing Brian-like characters are my new favorite kink. It might have something to do with my rediscovered passion for Placebo (I am a fan of the band since 1998). I fell in love with them all over again when their new album came out last year and I went to see them live last November three times in one week. They have always been amazing and fascinating and drop-dead sexy, but seeing Brian again with the long hair (and OMG the black nail polish is also back since the beginning of this week) just makes me deliriously happy. Looking at him I feel like it is 1998 all over again. How can it be that he doesn’t look a day older than back then? Okay Chrissy, I know you think he bathes in virgin blood, but even that can’t make such a difference. Maybe he drinks it?

But on to the good stuff. Here is the list of my favorite stories with delicious Nancy Brian characters by my favorite authors. I would appreciate if you could help me find new stories to add to that list. Recommendations anyone?

I don’t imply that the authors of those stories have really been inspired by Brian Molko. Some of them are in fact Placebo fans and some of them probably had other pretty boys in mind. I just say that the image fits.

Kieran Reilly of ‘Woman’s Weeds’ (‘Bravo! Brava!’-anthology) and ‘His Leading Man’ (‘Encore! Encore!’-anthology) written by Kimberly Gardner. Check out her website http://www.kimberlygardner.com for links to purchase those wonderful stories and to check out her other amazing e-books. Kimberly says she does not know where the inspiration came from. Kieran just popped up in her head one day.

Skyler Trent of ‘Only Words’ and ‘Any Excuse’ by Acer Adamson also known as Jaye Valentine. Go to his homepage http://www.macleodvalentine.com to find the links to both stories and many other delicious e-books he wrote together with his partner in crime Reno Macleod. Jaye is also a declared Placebo fan, so there might have been a bit of conscious or unconscious inspiration from looking at pretty pictures of Brian in a dress.

Brian O’Kelly of ‘Naked in the Rain’ and Afterglow’ by Eowyn Wood. Order those two heartbreakingly beautiful books (it’s one book in two parts and they are heavy paperbacks, not ebooks but so worth the wait to be shipped to your doorstep) at http://www.eowynwood.com and do not forget to order a box of paper handkerchiefs as well. You’re going to cry, a lot. Eowyn never made a secret of the fact that Brian Molko inspired her Brian O’Kelly. She even has Placebo lyrics printed in the first book. Read Eowyn’s blog about her inspiration for that intriguing character: http://eowynwood.blogspot.com

Asher – you must read all the Asher stories by Zoe Nichols. This naughty little minx will capture your heart and you won’t ever get enough of him. Visit Zoe and Asher now at http://www.zoe-nichols.com

Baby of the short story ‘baby’ written by Ally Blue. This story is actually a freebie on Ally’s site http://www.allyblue.com, but you should definitely check out all her other amazing ebooks about pretty boys. There are tons of them and all are beautifully written and some of them are about sexy rock stars. Ally Blue used to write Placebo-slash back in the day, so that answers your question about Brian being a possible inspiration for some of the character’s looks.


Shawn of ‘About Something’ (‘Bravo! Brava!’-anthology) and ‘Much Ado’ (‘Encore! Encore!’-anthology) written by Jet Mykles. Getting to read Shawn’s and Roscoe’s love story is another good reason to buy those two anthologies. Go to Jet’s homepage and also check out her ‘Heaven Sent’ series about five mouth watering boys in a rock band: http://www.jetmykles.com

Oliver Caldwell of ‘Windows in Time’ by M. Jules Aedin. Okay, Oliver only looks like Brian when he is in drag, but he is such a lovely character and this is such an original story, you have to read it. Would please someone make a movie out of that novel already!?! Find out more at http://mjules.net

Other writers with a lot of characters that resemble gorgeous Brian: Jade Falconer, Camilla Bruce, Sean Michael, Misa Izanaki, Zathyn Priest, Sara Bell and Mara Ismine.

Please let me know if you found more.

Love,

Anja

This is just to let you all know that I still use this journal even if I never wright anything. This sounds paradox but I use this journal to be able to leave posts in my favourite communities and to keep track of my friends. So please do not kick me off your friends lists just because I haven't commented in a while. I promise to comment more often in the future. Take care!
Love,
Anja
